alert.note: Alert for Chatham; Lee (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 3:56AM EST until further notice by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina... Deep River At Moncure affecting Lee and Chatham Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Deep River at Moncure. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Flooding is likely upstream of the gage site along North Plank Road just south of highway 421 in Lee county, and on R Jordan Road north of highway 421 in Chatham county. At the gage site, flooding reaches the base of the river gage housing, but is confined to woods and pasture immediately adjacent to the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 9.5 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 2:45 AM EST Wednesday was 9.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 9.5 feet this morning. It will then fall below flood stage this afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.3 feet on 02/09/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 am EST) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Sun Deep River Moncure 9.0 9.5 Wed 2 am EST 7.4 5.2 3.0 3.1 &&
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 400 PM EST.
